title: The Met Fifth Ave's New Roof Garden Commission: Ensemble
description: Sonic and visual artist Jennie C. Jones's acoustic sculptures take over the Met’s Iris and B. Gerald Cantor Roof Garden for the season.
cost: Free entry with museum admission (pay-what-you-wish admission for New York State residents and NY, NJ, and CT students, $30 general/$22 seniors/$22 visitors with disabilities/$17 students otherwise)

title: NYPL's World Literature + Arts Festival
description: Shining a spotlight on NYC’s communities, the New York Public Library’s World Literature + Arts Festival brings together writers, artists, and thinkers from diverse disciplines and backgrounds to celebrate storytelling.

title: Taste of Science Festival
description: Feed your curiosity with this annual series of informal discussions on everything from fungus to hunger to city infrastructure.
address: Pete's Candy Store (Williamsburg), Ryan's Daughter (UES), KGB (East Village), and Q.E.D. (Astoria)

title: Rent the Runway Sample Sale
description: Save up to 70% on pre-loved designer apparel, handbags, accessories, and more.

title: Newman's Own 'Pay-What-You-Want Food Truck'
description: Choose-what-you pay for Newman’s Own pizzas, salads, cookies, coffee dog treats, and more, with 100% of the proceeds going to Newman’s Own Foundation.
address: Bryant Park at 40th Street between 5th + 6th Aves

title: Beyond Architecture: The New New York – A Discussion on Historic Preservation
description: A discussion on 'Beyond Architecture: The New New York', a collection of essays marking the 60th anniversary of the New York City Landmarks Law.

title: Miller Theater’s Pop-Up Concert Series
description: The Columbia University School of the Arts’s musical happy hour returns for a new season of hour-long concerts where the audience is permitted to sit onstage with the performers and enjoy a free drink.

title: No New Things with Ashlee Piper
description: Sustainability expert Ashlee Piper chats about 'No New Things', her new book on ditching consumerism, regaining financial and mental wellness, and saving the planet.
cost: $5 admission can be applied towards any book or item in the café.

title: Early Risers vs. Night Owls: Comedy Debate
description: The popular comedy debate series returns with guests debating the merits of their preferred time of day.

title: Brooklyn Books + Booze
description: Hear established and up-and-coming authors of different genres read from their current works every third Tuesday of the month.

title: The Broad Squad
description: Kendra Cunningham presents a throwback variety show filled with stand up, storytelling, music, and trivia.

title: Open Mic + Open Tables
description: 15 comedians. 8 DJs. No cover. A new weekly series blending music and comedy.

title: Animation Nights New York
description: Watch a curated program of animated short films from around the world at this monthly screening event.
